snippet: Vice President Joseph R. Biden and presidents of some of the nation’s largest institutions met Tuesday to discuss a “shopping sheet,” which would help students compare schools.
abstract: Vice President Joseph R Biden and 10 college presidents meet to discuss a consumer-friendly 'shopping sheet' in the financial aid packages they send to incoming students, which would simplify the current process of comparing colleges; it would clearly state the cost of a year of classes, the student’s net cost after grants and scholarships, financial aid options to pay that cost and estimated monthly payments for federal loans.
lead_paragraph: Vice President Joseph R. Biden and presidents of some of the nation’s largest institutions met Tuesday to discuss a “shopping sheet,” which would help students compare schools.

headline.seo: Obama Officials Aim to Ease College Cost Process
headline.main: Biden and College Presidents Talk About Paying the Bills
headline.print_headline: Biden and College Presidents Talk About Paying the Bills
